# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = String[]
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) + sum(length.(lines[end - i] for i in 0:(i > length(lines) || i < 2) && i >= 0)) >= text_width
            push!(lines, word)
            while true
                pop!(lines)
                if isempty(lines) || length(lines[end]) + sum(length.(lines[end - i] for i in 0:(i > length(lines) || i < 2) && i >= 0)) >= text_width
                    break
                end
            end
        else
            push!(lines, word)
        end
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example
wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")  # should return "This function\nwill wrap\nwords into lines"
